awardsAndPubs.title: 3rd Place
awardsAndPubs.description:
The world's largest open robot competition (according to the Guinness Book of World Records)
The main challenge of this contest is to build an autonomous computer-controlled robot that can find its way through an arena that represents a model house, find a lit candle that represents a fire in the house, and extinguish the fire in the shortest time. This task simulates the real-world operation of an autonomous robot performing a fire protection function in a real house. The goal of the contest is to advance robot technology and knowledge while using robotics as an educational tool

testimonials.text: I worked with Abdullah between july 2017 and december 2018 inside the DROID. He was my supervisor during the IEEE-SEK/LARC 2017 and I worked directly with him in the IEEE-Open/LARC 2018, while he was the captain. He always has been very versatile and always looked forward to solve all the problems, although sometimes the problems weren't related to his area. He always defined clearly the team's priorities in order to accomplish the deadlines. He has deep knowledges in programming and hardware(embedded systems), being responsable of the most part of the robot's programming in IEEE-Open/LARC 2018.

Abdullah has managed to bring professors and students to work on a robot to compete at Latin American Robotics Competion. Other than that, has implemented agile methods similar to Kanban to organize the team in order to both meet deadlines and learn new technologies during the competition.

During the idealization and construction of the robot that would compete in LARC 2018 Abdullah has shown himself to be a great leader, allowing the team and himself to develop knowledge related to Mechatronics, specially embedded systems, all with great enthusiasm.
